intro: Morocarpus squamatus, commonly known as the silky morocarpus, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is known for its diverse and often ornamental species. The plant features fleshy, cylindrical stems covered in dense, white, woolly hairs that give it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and typically appear in late summer. Morocarpus squamatus is adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
